text:
Iskcon  Singapore version ?
i heard this is different from Iskcon  Mayapur,
but I only come for prayer when visit singapore.
i didnt know the different between iskcon or iskm but wherever Prabhupad Gaura Nitai Narasimha Tulasi Sri Radha Krishna deity there, i will come.
dont do aparadh please be carefull with what you do, Hare Krishna!

Nice to visit. Peaceful place for meditation. However, I would have expected a temple structure but not a very generic building occupying a floor as a temple. Good to have something than nothing but would be happy to see a temple in future. A must visit place. Inside decor, God, Goddesses were great. Looks miniature of ISKCON style. One thing to note, in general if we search ISKCON Singapore, by default you get this address at Gaylang Road. However there is another ISKCON temple near Mustafa at Little India. Pls make sure where you're heading to. Wheelchair accessibility is limited for visitors at the temple. Pls plan ahead. Thanks.

Bought some of the items from their eshop and the person who attended to me kesava krishna dasa not sure his name he was really patient and freindly to help me out with the items I need and packed nicely . recommend to everyone who want to buy their items the deity statues are lovely

I generally don't post stuff online, but the experiences I've had here for the last 3-4 times have made me do it.

The idea of a temple is when you can find solace and just be YOU. If you force yourself to have a conversation and preach why Krishna is above all the other gods, then I'm sorry to say, you don't have the my approval for this.

As much I am still follow Hinduism and am a Brahmin, the vibes here don't sync with what I'm looking for. I've been to enough ISKON temples in India, but never have I ever encountered such experiences.

My two cents - Unless the devotees voluntarily approach you with their intention to serve the temple, let them do their thing and leave them alone.

Iskon temple in Singapore.. Not the best in terms of space , they are planning out to move and go big.. We often visit on weekends for my kids classes and listen to the spiritual talks followed up with a Sunday Dinner with some Drama and cultural activities. Most of the preachings are to bring Krishna consciousness to the brains..
